originalLyrics:
Le monde a changé, il s'est déplacé quelques vertèbres
Le monde a changé, il s'est déplacé quelques vertèbres
Je veux plus écrire les peines que le féminin m'a fait
Dites à Jacquie et Michel de venir me chercher
Moi je veux faire comme tout l'monde, je veux juste un peu douter
Je crois que la Terre est ronde mais je préfère comploter
On peut pas changer les ombres, on peut juste les éclairer
Jusqu'à c'que le soleil tombe, lassé de nous réchauffer
Et dans nos envies de plages, d'UV A et d'UV B
J'en vois quelques uns qui nagent vers c'qu'on a déjà coulé
Mais si l'époque a des puces, c'est qu'elle a pas l'bon collier
La beauté, tu sais, ça s'use, c'est comme ton premier baiser

texts.title: Une Première Rencontre
text: - C'est ton premier cours de danse ?
- Oui, je suis un peu lassé d'être seul.
- Viens dans notre danse ronde !
- J'aimerais faire quelques pas avec vous.

texts.title: Notes Personnelles
text: Je veux écrire ce qui a changé.
On m'a déplacé de bureau aujourd'hui.
Dites-moi si vous voulez venir voir.
Je vais chercher à comprendre ce qui s'est fait.

texts.title: Réflexions sur la Vie
text: Le monde tourne autour du soleil sur la Terre,
Mes vertèbres portent le poids de mes peines,
Dans l'ombre du genre féminin se cachent
Toutes mes envies d'existence pure.

texts.title: Réflexions du Matin
text: Je ne peux plus attendre.
C'est déjà un peu juste.
Pas aujourd'hui, mais demain peut-être.

texts.title: Message à un Ami
text: Tout va bien avec ton projet ?
C'est bon de te revoir enfin.

texts.title: Pensées Nocturnes
text: Je crois qu'on peut faire changer les choses.
Est-ce qu'il faut douter quand tout tombe ?
Je préfère éclairer que comploter dans l'ombre.

texts.title: Observations Marines
text: Je vois comme tout s'use et se réchauffer.
Les poissons nagent où tout a coulé.
Je sais que rien ne dure.

texts.title: Souvenirs d'Été
text: Sur les plages de l'époque, les uns cherchaient
La beauté dans un simple collier,
Pendant que les puces dansaient au soleil.

texts.title: Message d'un Ami
text: Il m'a dit que je suis comme
une sœur à moi, mais on sait
que ce n'est pas vrai.
Il s'est adressé à me voir demain,
je vais y réfléchir.

texts.title: Espoir Quotidien
text: Jusqu'à ce que nous trouvions dans la vie
En vers qui nous guide si bien,
Qu'elle continue son chemin.

texts.title: Simplicité
text: Ça arrive comme ça parfois.

phrases.phraseTarget: - C'est ton premier cours de danse ?
- Oui, je suis un peu lassé d'être seul.
- Viens dans notre danse ronde !
- J'aimerais faire quelques pas avec vous.
Aujourd'hui, je veux écrire ce qui a changé.
On m'a déplacé de bureau aujourd'hui.
Dites-moi si vous voulez venir voir.
Je vais essayer de comprendre ces changements.
Le monde tourne autour du soleil,
Mes vertèbres portent le poids de mes peines,
Dans l'ombre du genre féminin se cachent
Toutes mes envies d'existence pure.
Je ne peux plus attendre.
En fait, c'est déjà un peu juste.
Pas aujourd'hui, mais peut-être demain matin.
Salut ! Tout va bien avec ton projet ?
C'est bon de te revoir enfin.
Je crois qu'on peut faire changer les choses.
Mais est-ce qu'il faut douter quand tout tombe ?
Je préfère éclairer que comploter dans l'ombre.
Je vois comme tout s'use et se réchauffe.
Et les poissons nagent où tout a coulé.
Maintenant, je sais que rien ne dure.
Sur les plages de l'époque, les uns cherchaient
La beauté dans un simple collier,
Pendant que les puces dansaient au soleil.
Il m'a dit que je suis comme une sœur pour lui
mais on sait que ce n'est pas vrai.
Il m'a proposé de nous voir demain
je vais y réfléchir et lui répondre.
Dans la vie, nous cherchons toujours
Un chemin qui nous guide si bien,
Et la vie continue son chemin
Ça arrive comme ça parfois, c'est la vie.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Is this your first dance class?
alternatives: Is it your first dance lesson?
Are you new to dance class?
distractors: Is this your dance class?
Was this your last dance class?
Is this your first cooking class?

solutions.primaryTranslation: Yes, I'm a bit tired of being alone.
alternatives: Yes, I'm getting tired of being by myself.
Yes, I'm somewhat fed up with being alone.
distractors: Yes, I'm a bit happy being alone.
Yes, I'm a bit tired of being busy.
Yes, I'm tired of being alone.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Join our circle dance!
alternatives: Come dance with us in the circle!
distractors: Watch our circle dance!
Join our square dance!
Join our dance!

solutions.primaryTranslation: I'd like to dance a few steps with you.
alternatives: I would love to dance with you.
I'd like to share a few dance moves with you.
distractors: I'd like to dance many steps with you.
I'd like to dance a few steps alone.
I'd like to dance with you.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Today, I want to write about what has changed.
alternatives: I want to write about the changes today.
Today, I'll write about what's different.
distractors: Today, I want to write about what needs to change.
Today, I want to write about what will change.
Today, I want to write about the changes.

solutions.primaryTranslation: I was moved to a different office today.
alternatives: I had to change offices today.
distractors: I was moved in the office today.
I will be moved to a different office today.
I was moved to an office.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Let me know if you want to come see.
alternatives: Tell me if you'd like to come take a look.
Tell me if you want to come check it out.
distractors: Let me know you want to come see.
Don't let me know if you ever want to come see.
Let me know if you wanted to come

solutions.primaryTranslation: I'm going to try to understand these changes.
alternatives: I'll try to make sense of these changes.
I'm going to attempt to understand these changes.
distractors: I'm going to understand these changes.
I tried to understand these changes.
I'm going to try to forget these changes.

solutions.primaryTranslation: The world revolves around the sun,
alternatives: The world turns around the sun,
distractors: The sun revolves around the world,
The world revolves towards the sun,
The worlds revolve all around the sun

solutions.primaryTranslation: My spine bears the weight of my sorrows,
alternatives: My vertebrae carry the burden of my pain,
My back carries the weight of my troubles,
distractors: My spine bears my sorrows,
My spine carries the weight of my happiness,
My spine will bear the weight of my sorrows,

solutions.primaryTranslation: Hidden in the shadow of the feminine gender
distractors: Hidden in shadow of feminine
Visible in the shadow of the feminine gender
Hidden in the light of the feminine gender

solutions.primaryTranslation: All my desires for pure existence.
alternatives: All my yearnings for authentic life.
distractors: Some of my desires for pure existence.
All my desires for existence.
All my hatred for pure existence.

solutions.primaryTranslation: I can't wait any longer.
distractors: I must wait longer.
I can wait any longer.
I couldn't wait yesterday.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Actually, it's already cutting it close.
alternatives: In fact, we're already running short on time.
distractors: Actually, it's never cutting it close.
It's already cutting it close.
Actually, it will be cutting it close.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Not today, but maybe tomorrow morning.
alternatives: Not for today, but possibly tomorrow morning.
distractors: Today, but maybe tomorrow morning.
Not today, but definitely tomorrow morning.
Not today, but maybe yesterday morning.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Hi! How's your project going?
alternatives: Hey! Is everything going well with your project?
Hello! How's the project coming along?
distractors: Hi! Your project is finished?
Hi! Why did your project fail?
Hi! Are you starting project?

solutions.primaryTranslation: It's good to finally see you again.
alternatives: Great to see you at last.
It's nice to see you after so long.
distractors: It's bad to finally see you again.
It's good to never see you again.
It's good finally you.

solutions.primaryTranslation: I believe we can make things change.
alternatives: I think we can make a difference.
I believe we can create change.
distractors: I believe things will never change.
I believe we must prevent change.
I believe make things.

solutions.primaryTranslation: But should we doubt when everything falls apart?
alternatives: Should we lose faith when everything crumbles?
But must we question everything when it all comes down?
distractors: But we must believe when everything falls apart?
But should we celebrate when everything falls apart?
But should we doubt when everything succeeds?

solutions.primaryTranslation: I prefer to illuminate rather than plot in the shadows.
alternatives: I'd rather bring light than scheme in darkness.
Better to enlighten than conspire in shadow.
distractors: I prefer to hide rather than illuminate truth.
I prefer to illuminate and plot in shadows.
I prefer illuminate shadows.

solutions.primaryTranslation: I see how everything wears down and heats up.
alternatives: I watch as everything deteriorates and warms
I observe how all things wear out and warm up
distractors: I see how everything wears down and cools down.
I see everything wears down and heats up.
I will see how everything wore down and heated up.

solutions.primaryTranslation: And fish swim where everything has sunk.
alternatives: And fish swim through the sunken remains
And fish swim where all has gone under
distractors: And fish swim where nothing has sunk.
And fish swim where everything floats.
And fish where everything has sunk.

solutions.primaryTranslation: Now I know that nothing lasts.
alternatives: Now I understand nothing is permanent
Now I realize everything is temporary
distractors: Now I know that everything lasts.
I know that nothing lasts.
Now I knew that nothing lasted.

solutions.primaryTranslation: On the beaches of that time, some people searched
alternatives: Back then on the beaches, people were looking
On those bygone beaches, some sought
distractors: In the beaches of that time, some people searched
On the beaches of that time, all people searched
On the beaches, some people searched

solutions.primaryTranslation: For beauty in a simple necklace,
alternatives: For beauty within a plain necklace
distractors: For beauty in a complex necklace,
Beauty in a simple necklace,
For beauty with a simple necklace,

solutions.primaryTranslation: While fleas danced in the sunlight.
alternatives: As fleas danced in the sun
While fleas frolicked in the sunshine
distractors: While birds danced in the sunlight.
While fleas slept in the sunlight.
While fleas danced in darkness.

solutions.primaryTranslation: He told me I'm like a sister to him
alternatives: He said he thinks of me as a sister
He told me he sees me as a sister
distractors: He told me I'm like a brother to him.
She told me I'm like a sister to him.
He told me I'm nothing like a sister to him.

solutions.primaryTranslation: but we know that's not true.
alternatives: but everyone knows that isn't true
distractors: but we know that's very true.
but they know that's not true.
but we think that's not true.

solutions.primaryTranslation: He suggested we meet tomorrow
alternatives: He proposed we see each other tomorrow
He asked to see me tomorrow
distractors: He suggested we met yesterday.
She suggested we meet tomorrow.
He refused to meet tomorrow.

solutions.primaryTranslation: I'll think about it and get back to him.
alternatives: I'm going to think it over and respond
I'll consider it and give him an answer
distractors: I won't think about it at all.
I'll think about it and ignore him.
I'll think about it.

solutions.primaryTranslation: In life, we're always searching
alternatives: In life, we never stop looking
distractors: In life, we're never searching
In life, searching
In life, we searched yesterday

solutions.primaryTranslation: A path that guides us so well
alternatives: A way that leads us true
A path that shows us the way so perfectly
distractors: A path that confuses us so well
A path guides well
A path that guided us badly

solutions.primaryTranslation: And life goes on its way
distractors: And life stops its way
Life goes way
And life went on their way

solutions.primaryTranslation: These things happen sometimes, that's life.
alternatives: That's just how it goes sometimes, such is life
It happens like that sometimes, that's the way life is
distractors: These things never happen, that's life.
Things happen, life.
These things happened yesterday, that's death.
